body: After these changes, every thing looks good from my perspective. Lets have Steven do the final review before the merge.
Just remembered. These changes to the return type should change the test results.

Something is confusing here. It seems that this change includes the refactoring that I did a few days ago. Also, there seem to be conflicts with master. Could you resolve the conflicts and make sure, that only your new code is in the change?
Looks good to me. Please prepare for the merge (single commit with a nice message).
Please add one test case: when two objects have the same key. Then I think this change is ready to go.
These changes seem to be already in master. Shall I create a new PR with the tests?
It a little tough to pick out your changes. Does it matter if null is the second arithmetic argument?
Yes, Please.
Looks good to me - haven't run tests ...
Looks good to me.
Looks good. Prepare for merge.

Just a few quick thoughts/questions:
1. The escaping of the XML entities in the tests looks ugly, but it might be the right thing to do - haven't thought carefully about this. 
2. Where do those entities get introduced? During the evaluation of fn:serialize or in the serialization of the final output?
3. If it's the serialization of the final output, do we have a way to avoid that and get a "readable" output for some queries (e.g. by wrapping the strings in some container)?
4. Do the XQTS tests for fn:serialize pass?

This seems fine to me. Please merge with master, squash into a single commit, and make a meaningful commit message. Don't forget to include the issue number in the first line and leave the second line blank
Looks good. Prep for merge.
The merge had a conflict. It appears github does not recognize that this commit has been merged. Please close.

1. It seems like escaping XML entities is nice for some scenarios, but I am not sure if its right for all.
2. It seems the XML entities are added when serialization of the final output. (At least that is my guess from looking at code. Christina can you confirm with your new trace function?)
3. Nothing currently exists.
4. The fn:serialize function is part of the XQuery 3.0 specification. Currently we are using XQuery 1.0 Test Suite.
I have checked with the trace function and these entities are indeed added in the final output.
While there seems to be some questions on how to print a serialized value, I think this change is a good step in the right direction. Should we merge it as is?
This approach looks good to me.
Could you create a single patch for this?

I think that there's a bug here. The query 
`libjn:accumulate(({ "a": { "c": "d" } }, { "a": { "c": "d" } }))`
should return
`{"a":[{"c":"d"},{"c":"d"}]}`
as accumulate should not be applied recursively. The current implementation returns 
`{"a":{"c":"d"}}`.
Please add test cases for nested object and non-homogenous sequences containing objects, arrays, and scalar values.

The fact that libjn:accumulate(({ "a": { "c": "d" } }, { "a": { "c": "d" } })) returns {"a":{"c":"d"}} because since the specification for libjn:accumulate was not clear, I thought that it would behave similar to libjn:intersect and added a check to remove duplicate values for the same key when accumulating into an array. So one  { "c": "d" } is removed because it's a duplicate value. 

You can test with an entry like libjn:accumulate(({ "a": { "c": "d" } }, { "a": { "e": "f" } })) which would return {"a":[{"c":"d"},{"e":"f"}]}. I shall add this test case also.
Did you create an issue for this error? Lets link this change to an issue. Otherwise, I think its ready to be squashed and committed.
Please squash and prepare for commit.
Please include the change to the menu. We need to remove the link to page that is being deleted.
Looks good, squash and prepare for commit.
Please squash and prepare for commit.
Looks good to me. Please squash and prepare for commit.
I think this PR has been wrapped up in another PR. Please close.
Can this be closed? Is this change in a new PR?
Has this change been integrated into a different PR?
Merged. Please close.

I did the changes according to the code review and also completed the user documentation.
- The issue with show-index output is fixed.
- Cleaned up the code and exceptions.

Issues.
The results of collection-from-index query are not printed to the console. I'm working on fixing it.

I changed the bash scripts (startcc.sh and startnc.h) because the syntax of the if statement was wrong. When the shortcut of the if statement is used the symbol && should replace the "if then " command. That symbol was missing in the previous implementation.

Wow, this was simpler than I expected. Nice work. I have one comment. In several methods, you change the value of an argument passed in and its not related to passing a value back to the caller. I think we should not change a method's argument value unless we are passing a result back to the caller.

Very nice!
To make it even better, I think that it would be good to think about the memory allocation patterns here. I've added a specific comment in one of the relevant places where we allocate  `ArrayBackedValueStorage`s but this also applies to other places.
Looks good! Just 2 whitespace fixes before we commit.

Another option would be to use one mvs for all keys. Instead of having getKeys reset and start a new key data block, it could just append the key values. The advantage would be you could keep one mvs for all key values. You caller would still have to maintain many key pointables, but only one array backed value store. An easy way to implement this would be to have getKeys take two arguments: IMutableValueStorage mvs and IPointable result. This method would would not reset the mvs and it would give a result pointable for where the appended keys are located.
Thanks. I have updated PR based on the suggestions
Is the only thing left for this change to start using the new AVBS pool?
Do we have tests for parallel indexing (for 1, 2 and 4 partitions)?

I think any major issue with this PR can be fixed later. Lets just create issues for any of these issues.
For example:
Can you create an issue for updating indexing to support the "source" variable (as I understand it uses absolute paths instead of relative)?
Yes it uses absolute path. I'll create a Jira issue for it.

Yes it's the only thing left. I have been thinking whether I need to use Singleton pattern to make all classes use the same ArrayBackedValueStoragePool or what design principle is needed to make sure all classes use one instance of the pool rather than creating a new one all the time?

For simplicity, I would create a new pool for each evaluator, similar to
the pointable pools. While you could come up with another solution, I think
this works with the framework hyracks provides. The result would be one
pool per function (per partition).

notifications@github.com> wrote:

> Singleton pattern to make all classes use the same
> ArrayBackedValueStoragePool or what design principle is needed to make sure
> all classes use one instance of the pool rather than creating a new one all
> the time?

These instructions are nice, but I think that they'd be even better with example command lines.
Looks good to me!
I added a few comments, but this looks like your going in the right direction.
Christina merged these changes in a different PR.
Can this be merged?

I used `mvn dependency:analyze` to find out which dependencies we actually had in the code vs which we had declared in the poms. We had some which we didn't declare in the poms but which we used - those only worked because another dependency recursively depended on them. And there were some that we declared but never used. So the ones that are apparently new should be the ones that we used but didn't declare.
The change looks good. Did this ever get merged?
What is the status of this change?
This is an outdated pull request. The updated one is here: https://github.com/apache/vxquery/pull/163

I was reviewing Jenkins and found there are still a few errors in your PR.
https://asterix-jenkins.ics.uci.edu/job/vxquery-pr/399/
Closing issue after addressing the comments and creating a squashed version.
The changes look good. Does this mean you do not need to make changes to the group by operators?
As we think about merging this PR. What VXQuery issues is this fixing? We will need to create a nice commit message that outlines all the changes and includes the issue numbers.
Cherry picked this commit.
Remember to update the site examples for indexing.
Merged change into the site prep for the next release.

Is there any documentation that needs to be updated? Such as managing a cluster: http://vxquery.apache.org/user_cluster_installation.html
Also should we create an API page to document the end points?
Can you explain how this project interacts with vxquery-server? Will the server start the REST api?

Hi @prestoncarman! At the moment, users have to setup the cluster separately and give the **cluster controller's ip and port** in a properties file.

But I'm currently going through the [AsterixDB's CCApplication class](https://github.com/apache/asterixdb/blob/master/asterixdb/asterix-app/src/main/java/org/apache/asterix/hyracks/bootstrap/CCApplication.java) to adapt a similar thing to [VXQueryApplication class](https://github.com/erandiganepola/vxquery/blob/master/vxquery-rest/src/main/java/org/apache/vxquery/rest/VXQueryApplication.java).

Your suggestions on this will greatly help me  to come up with a solution.

Thank you!

I think the user should have a single command/script to start the Cluster (Hyracks - cluster controller and all data nodes and the REST service). It would be nice if all the setting for the cluster were in a single properties file. I would think that vxquery-server project would be responsible for starting the REST service after the cluster controller has been started. This may require some refactoring. Does this make sense?

Is this ready for review? Did you get the filter on value working?
Also, please include a rule comment at the top outlining the before and after state of the plan.
I need to remove some code but other than that it is ready...I fixed the problem with search query
Go ahead and remove the code and add the rule comments, then I will review the code.

I have altered my implementation to match the feedback given above in the PR. Now along with the ClusterController, VXQueryApplication starts. RestServer is started within the VXQueryApplication. Also I have moved the configuration loading part to VXQueryApplication start time as well. I did this by giving the VXQueryApplication as a command line argument through the app-assembler maven plugin. 

I'll cover the documentation part during my last two weeks of the timeline (as I proposed in GSoC proposal timeline)

The REST code should still be in its own maven project. See the mailing list for the project hierarchy. Just make the configuration (the port number) for REST come from the various calling application.
I got the point. I will move the REST code into its own maven project.
All the test cases that have a prefix useindex test the new functionality....however, the only way to verify that the rule actually works is by debugging. I checked that and it works fine.
I updated the PR according to the suggestions given above and the VXQuery CLI code is pushed to this PR as well.
I see you added tests for attributes and indexing. Does this mean that the indexing works for attributes without any changes?

Yes, it works....the only change I made was that instead of storing the length of the attribute in the constructor of IndexAttributes (was always 0 since the constructor always initializes the lists) I store it one of the methods where I add elements in the lists.
Hyracks has now pushed its latest release. Can you update this patch to use the last published version?
Merged in Erandi's PR.
These changes seem good since there are no dependencies problems.
Nice, we can actually use the Hyracks string functions. Looks good to merge.

The regression tests have a few issues.
https://asterix-jenkins.ics.uci.edu/view/%20VXQuery/job/vxquery-pr/524/
These changes have been merged. I pull this change and updated it for master. This can be closed.
This code has been merged. PR can be closed.
Looks good to me. Thanks for moving us to the latest Hyracks release. We have tried several time to do this but it never was finished.
